string-array.name: bench_press_tips
string-array.item: Set Up Properly – Lie on the bench with feet flat on the ground, back slightly arched, and eyes under the bar.
Grip the Bar Correctly – Use a grip slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping wrists straight and elbows at about 75-degree angles.
Control the Descent – Lower the bar slowly to your mid-chest, keeping elbows tucked (not flared out).
Engage Your Muscles – Press the bar up with power, driving through your chest and triceps while keeping your back tight.
Use a Spotter – If lifting heavy, always have a spotter for safety and confidence.

string-array.name: treadmill_tips
string-array.item: Start Slow & Warm Up – Begin with a 5-minute walk or light jog to loosen up your muscles.
Maintain Good Posture – Keep your back straight, look forward, and avoid gripping the handrails.
Use a Slight Incline – Set the incline to 1–2% to mimic outdoor running conditions.
Focus on Your Stride – Run with a natural stride, landing midfoot, and avoid overstriding.
Cool Down Properly – Gradually slow down your pace for a few minutes before stopping.

string-array.name: squat_tips
string-array.item: Set Up Properly – Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out, and barbell resting on your upper back (not your neck).
Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight and chest up to maintain a strong, stable posture.
Control the Descent – Lower yourself by pushing your hips back and bending your knees until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
Drive Through Your Heels – Push up through your heels (not your toes) to engage your glutes and avoid knee strain.
Maintain Proper Alignment – Keep your knees tracking over your toes and avoid caving inward.

string-array.name: stationary_biking_tips
string-array.item: Adjust the Seat Height – Set the seat so your knee has a slight bend (about 25–30 degrees) at the bottom of the pedal stroke.
Maintain Good Posture – Keep your back straight, core engaged, and avoid hunching over the handlebars.
Use Proper Resistance – Adjust the resistance to challenge your legs without causing knee strain or excessive bouncing.
Pedal Smoothly – Use a steady cadence (RPM) rather than pushing too hard or pedaling too fast.
Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight to improve balance and efficiency.

string-array.name: pull_ups_tips
string-array.item: Grip the Bar – Use an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width, to engage your back muscles effectively.
Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight and avoid excessive swinging for better control.
Pull with Your Back – Focus on pulling your elbows down rather than just using your arms.
Full Range of Motion – Lower yourself completely before pulling up again to maximize muscle activation.
Progress Gradually – If struggling, use resistance bands or an assisted pull-up machine to build strength.

string-array.name: deadlift_tips
string-array.item: Set Up Properly – Stand with feet hip-width apart, bar close to your shins, and grip just outside your knees.
Engage Your Core – Keep your core tight and maintain a neutral spine to protect your lower back.
Drive Through Your Heels – Lift by pushing through your heels while keeping the bar close to your body.
Lockout at the Top – Fully extend your hips and squeeze your glutes at the top without overextending.
Control the Descent – Lower the bar in a controlled manner to avoid injury.

string-array.name: shoulder_press_tips
string-array.item: Start with Proper Posture – Sit or stand with a straight back, core engaged, and feet shoulder-width apart.
Grip the Dumbbells Correctly – Hold the dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
Press Overhead – Extend your arms fully while keeping a slight bend in your elbows at the top.
Control the Movement – Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
Avoid Excessive Arching – Keep your back neutral and avoid leaning too far backward.

string-array.name: lunges_tips
string-array.item: Step Forward – Take a big step forward while keeping your torso upright.
Lower with Control – Bend both knees until your back knee is just above the floor.
Keep Knees Aligned – Ensure your front knee stays in line with your foot and does not cave inward.
Push Back to Starting Position – Drive through your front heel to return to a standing position.
Alternate Legs – Perform equal reps on each leg for balanced development.

string-array.name: plank_tips
string-array.item: Start in Proper Position – Keep your forearms on the ground and body in a straight line from head to heels.
Engage Your Core – Tighten your abs and avoid letting your hips sag or rise too high.
Maintain a Neutral Neck – Keep your head in line with your spine and avoid looking up or down.
Breathe Steadily – Focus on controlled breathing to help sustain the hold.
Increase Time Gradually – Start with shorter holds and gradually increase duration for progress.

string-array.name: bicep_curl_tips
string-array.item: Start with a Strong Stance – Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and dumbbells at your sides.
Keep Your Elbows Stationary – Avoid swinging your arms or using momentum.
Control the Movement – Lift the dumbbells smoothly and squeeze your biceps at the top.
Lower Slowly – Lower the weights in a controlled manner to maximize muscle engagement.
Avoid Overloading – Use a weight that allows proper form without excessive strain.

string-array.name: russian_twists_tips
string-array.item: Sit at a 45-degree Angle – Keep your core tight.
Use a Weight for Extra Challenge – If comfortable.
Twist Fully – Engage obliques in every movement.
Keep a Steady Pace – Avoid rushing through the reps.
Control Your Breathing – Exhale as you twist.

string-array.name: lateral_raises_tips
string-array.item: Keep a Slight Bend in the Elbows – Avoid locking them out.
Lift to Shoulder Height – Not higher.
Use Light Weights – Focus on controlled motion.
Avoid Swinging – Engage your core for stability.
Lower Slowly – Prevents momentum from taking over.

string-array.name: lat_pulldown_tips
string-array.item: Grip Slightly Wider than Shoulder Width – Maximizes lat engagement.
Pull to Your Chest – Avoid pulling behind the head.
Control the Movement – Lower the weight slowly.
Keep Your Back Straight – Do not lean too far back.
Engage Your Core – Prevents excessive swinging.

string-array.name: push_ups_tips
string-array.item: Maintain a Straight Body – Keep your core tight to avoid sagging.
Lower Slowly – Bring your chest close to the ground while keeping elbows tucked.
Push Explosively – Engage your chest, shoulders, and triceps.
Vary Hand Placement – Wider stance for chest, closer stance for triceps.
Control Breathing – Inhale on the way down, exhale on the push.

string-array.name: incline_bench_press_tips
string-array.item: Set the Bench at 30-45 Degrees – This targets the upper chest effectively.
Use a Slightly Narrower Grip – Helps engage the chest while protecting the shoulders.
Control Your Descent – Lower the bar to the upper chest slowly.
Drive with Power – Push the bar up while keeping control of the movement.
Avoid Overarching – Maintain proper posture to prevent lower back strain.

string-array.name: stairs_mastery_tips
string-array.item: Maintain a Steady Pace – Avoid rushing to prevent injury.
Use Your Arms – Swing them naturally to maintain balance.
Engage Your Core – Keep your back straight and core tight.
Land Softly – Step lightly to reduce impact on your joints.
Increase Intensity Gradually – Add weight or increase speed as you progress.

string-array.name: crunch_tips
string-array.item: Lie Flat on Your Back – Keep your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Engage Your Core – Lift your upper body without using momentum.
Keep Your Chin Up – Avoid tucking your chin into your chest.
Exhale as You Lift – Helps activate the abs more effectively.
Lower Slowly – Control the descent for maximum muscle engagement.

string-array.name: leg_raise_tips
string-array.item: Lie on Your Back – Keep your hands under your hips for support.
Keep Legs Straight – Lift them up slowly without bending the knees.
Engage Your Lower Abs – Focus on controlled movement.
Lower Slowly – Don\'t let your feet touch the ground between reps.
Modify if Needed – Bend your knees slightly for an easier variation.

string-array.name: flutter_kicks_tips
string-array.item: Lie Flat on Your Back – Keep your hands under your glutes for support.
Lift Your Legs Slightly – Keep them hovering above the floor.
Alternate Leg Kicks – Move them up and down in a controlled motion.
Engage Your Core – Prevent lower back strain.
Breathe Steadily – Avoid holding your breath.

string-array.name: bicycle_abs_tips
string-array.item: Lie on Your Back – Place your hands behind your head lightly.
Lift Your Legs – Alternate touching each elbow to the opposite knee.
Keep the Motion Controlled – Don’t rush the movement.
Engage Your Core – Twist your torso, not just your arms.
Exhale as You Twist – Helps with muscle activation.

string-array.name: pectoral_flys_tips
string-array.item: Lie on a Bench – Hold dumbbells with a slight bend in your elbows.
Lower the Dumbbells Slowly – Keep the motion controlled.
Engage Your Chest – Squeeze your pecs as you bring the weights back up.
Avoid Overstretching – Don’t go too deep to prevent shoulder strain.
Use Light to Moderate Weights – Focus on form over heavy lifting.
